revised_title: Influence of Carbonic Acid in Respiration and Blood
tldr: The author, William Stevens, challenges the misconception that venous blood contains no carbonic acid. Through experiments, he demonstrates that venous blood does contain carbonic acid and that it is extracted by atmospheric air. He also presents a theory of respiration, stating that the blood undergoes a change in the capillary system, forming carbonic acid and evolving heat. The bright red color of arterial blood is attributed to the action of saline ingredients in the blood.
